title: BLISS Formula for Selecting Hide Sites
brief: Use the BLISS criteria to select effective hiding locations when evading capture.
steps: Step 1: Find location that Blends in with natural surroundings - matches local vegetation and terrain colors.
Step 2: Choose position that is Low in silhouette - doesn't stick up above surrounding terrain features.
Step 3: Select spot that is Irregular in shape - avoid geometric patterns that look man-made.
Step 4: Pick area that is Small in size - just big enough for your team, no larger.
Step 5: Ensure location is Secluded - away from trails, roads, water sources, and human activity.
warnings: Avoid existing buildings or shelters as they are likely to be searched.
Do not cut vegetation in the immediate area as this leaves obvious signs.
Never occupy a hide site for more than 24 hours.
